newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish construction firm plans November IPO.
newsitem.headline: Polish construction firm plans November IPO.

text.p: Polish construction firm Energoaparatura SA plans a public offering for next month and wants to enter the parallel market of the Warsaw bourse, the company's chief executive said on Thursday.

"We will enter the parallel floor with the final price available no later than two days before the issue," Jozef Zajac told a news conference after the Polish Securities Commission approved 2,155,400 of the firm's shares for public trade.

The company's main shareholders are: The Polish Private Equity Fund I with 21 percent, the Polish Private Equity Fund II with 20.4 percent, the Polish-American Enterprise Fund with 18.6 percent and bank PBR 15 percent.
The company will offer 320,000 shares ex-rights from November 18 to November 22 and will offer 20,000 shares to employees on November 18 and November 19.
Zajac said the majority of the proceeds from the issue would go towards purchases of new computers, painting and production machinery and working capital.
Energoaparatura netted 1.8 million zlotys last year on sales of 41.2 million zlotys. It netted 1.3 milion zlotys in this year's first half on sales of 25.9 million zlotys.
